embeds.title: Inkeep Sandbox - AI search and chat
embeds.description: Inkeep provides LLM-powered search and support copilots for companies with technical products. With Inkeep, you can provide immediate answers to user questions by leveraging your docs, help center content, forums, and more.

messages.content: Thanks <@1410538819375202415> for the feedback, we've been spending some effort revisiting all the docs to make sure they're up to date, accurate, but also easier to consume. I'll make sure we revisit this topic and clean it up!

<@1133022375051542558>  thanks for the link. Now i mostly know how to navigate it, now it means that infrahub did in fact documented it somewhere, it will be highly appreciated if those section are linked with hyperlink! ðŸ™‚

https://docs.infrahub.app/topics/schema#branch-support

## Branch Support Options

- Aware (default): All changes will be local to the branch and can be merged back into the main branch. This supports Diff, Merge, and Rebase operations.
- Agnostic: All changes will automatically be available in all branches. This does not support Diff, Merge, or Rebase operations.
- Local: All changes will stay local to the branch and will not be merged to other branches. This does not support Diff or Merge operations, but does support Rebase.

## Configuration Examples

To configure a model as branch-agnostic:
```
nodes:
  - name: Fruit
    namespace: Example
    branch: "agnostic"
    attributes:
      - kind: Text
        name: name
```

## Individual Attribute/Relationship Configuration

Attributes and relationships can be configured independently of their parent model using the branch parameter:
```
nodes:
  - name: Fruit
    namespace: Example
    branch: "agnostic"
    attributes:
      - kind: Text
        name: name
        branch: "aware"
```

## Default Behavior
By default, if no specific value is defined:

- Attributes inherit the configuration of their parent model
- Relationships become branch-agnostic only if both models are branch-agnostic, otherwise they become branch-aware

Branch-Agnostic Usage
In the frontend, API, or GraphQL endpoint, branch-agnostic objects can be modified on any branch with no restrictions.

Hi all, is there any documentation that will explain what do all those option for with example provided or explanation? currently i am reading infrahub documentation, and I find that, i can totally understand inside schema > node > there support branch, and the branch accepted values are: aware (default), agnostic, local. however I do not know how is this impact or change when i put in different value such as local.
